snippet: State Republicans are so determined to keep low-income people from getting Medicaid that they may copy their national counterparts and shut down the government.
abstract: Editorial observes that group of Virginia Republicans are so determined to block expansion of Medicaid that they are holding up passage of budget, threatening shutdown of state government; holds that intransigence has left 400,000 low-income residents without coverage; supports Gov Terry McAuliffe's effort to expand Medicaid without legislative approval.
lead_paragraph: State Republicans are so determined to keep low-income people from getting Medicaid that they may copy their national counterparts and shut down the government.

headline.main: A Health Care Showdown in Virginia
headline.print_headline: A Health Care Showdown in Virginia

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
